Greetings to Prime Minister of Bulgaria
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Bulgaria
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Simeon Saxcoburgotski, prime minister of Bulgaria, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished him success in his responsible work for the economic development of the country.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Bulgarian counterpart Solomon Isak Passi on this occasion.

Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) - A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League headed by its First Secretary Kim Kyong Ho left here today to visit China.
 A delegation of the Korean Christian Federation headed by its Chairman Kang Yong Sop also left here to visit Germany and Switzerland.

articles.title: Greetings to Bulgarian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Bulgarian President
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Georgi Parvanov, president of Bulgaria, on the occasion of its national day.
 Wishing the president greater success in his work for the promotion of the people's wellbeing, the message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back from China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back from China
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, returned today after participating in the six-way talks on the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the United States held in Beijing.
 It was greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and Guan Huabing, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: North Side's Delegation Leaves for Seoul
articles.content:
North Side's Delegation Leaves for Seoul
    Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by Choe Yong Gon, vice-minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries who is north side's chairman of the North-South Committee for the Promotion of Economic Cooperation, left Pyongyang today to participate in the 8th meeting of the committee to be held in Seoul.
 It was seen off at the airport by Jong Mun San, chief secretary of the Cabinet, and officials concerned.
